result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy W. Morss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any.  And up to 25% of prison funds. Balance due prior to the end of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Pay supervision fees.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time/part time employment and/or schooling.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No possession of any illegally controlled substances.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings.
AODA assessment.  Follow up care and treatment as recommended.  Random screening.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen DNA to the State crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy W. Morss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, to run concurrent to case 15CF004187 with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, and up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment is to be entered against the Defendant and subject to other collection.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment as recommended.
*  No possession of any illegally controlled substances.
*  Random screening.
*  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Defendant is to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Appeals rights given.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Timothy W. Morss in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Timothy W. Morss in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed witih Sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 44.

Defendant Timothy W. Morss in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Timothy W. Morss in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy W. Morss in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Timothy W. Morss in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Timothy W. Morss not in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
